column1: Before 1 November 2022, will Twitter announce that Parag Agrawal has ceased or will cease to be the company's sole CEO?
column6: ['Business', 'Technology', 'Leader Entry/Exit']
Going down a bit actually. It is asking when Twitter will announce that Parag Agrawal has ceased to be the CEO (not when it actually happens). Not sure what would constitute Twitter announcing this.
It sounds like this might already have happened, but what we need is the announcement, which I suspect will come Friday or Monday, depending on what kind of news cycle Musk thinks it is
Ouch
Still waiting on the official announcement, but I think it’s pretty definite at this point
CNBC reporting that Twitter's CEO and CFO have both left the company and that Elon Musk is now in charge.
Dang, zigged when I shoulda zagged.

Musk visited thew twitter headquarters yesterday and has changed his twitter title to chief of twitter. It seems that he is being pressured to go through with the deal and I believe he is too proud to not do it.

Musk visited Twitter headquarters yesterday, met with staff. He also changed his Twitter bio to chief twit. There's a video going around today, on Twitter, where Musk is laughing saying that he'd just copy WeChat (that app has 1.4 billion users, mainly in China, requires gov ID, bank account, registered phone number to join, and is heavily censored (no posts or messages go through without passing algorithm scan for censored words). But when he says this, it seems that he's focusing on the success of WeChat (number of users plus the $16B in revenue it brings each year). I don't think Musk has a plan yet and that he's buying, if he signs tomorrow, because he is being forced to. He's laughing his way through the whole thing.
Elon calls himself "Chief Twit": https://twitter.com/elonmusk
Looks like they will close. I think Musk will take the CEO role and I think he will announce ASAP after the close.
Saeculum obscurum
Elon addressing Twitter staff on Friday: https://seekingalpha.com/news/3895803-twitter-inches-higher-amid-report-musk-will-address-staff-friday
Going to hug the 19% crowd consensus a bit. This reluctance to go up despite some other forecasters going up may signal something.
Lots of technicalities I'm uncertain of.
Looks like this might close on time after all. I may increase this again tomorrow.
Deal may close this friday and it is possible that Musk will become CEO over the weekend. Timing is tough but upgrading the possibility of change slightly.

While it is reasonable to state that Parag Agrawal will definitely be replaced, the question is a matter of how long the transfer process occurs. Given that there is a week left in the month with debates over trials and results, it is still more unlikely that changes in Twitter CEO positions will change within the timeframe.
Bloomberg, Reuters, others reporting "Musk Tells Bankers He Plans to Close Twitter Deal on Friday" (October 28 as stipulated by judge or go to trial)
https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1532568
@Jayce
We are no longer at one percent. I imagine if the deal really does go through as quickly as was just announced, one of the first priorities will be a new CEO
There seem to be delays in closing the deal, and there is only about a week left.
The deal is set to close on Friday 28 OCT 2022. I find a low chance of probability that a decision will be made on the CEO before NOV 01.
Purely on time decay, it seems unlikely over the week.
On Tuesday, 4 October, Twitter's investment relations account tweeted:

Dropping this probability in half to 5%. US government is looking into the deal for national security reasons since some of Musk's financial backers are foreign nationals. His new strategy seems to be to get Twitter to cancel the deal on him. He says he will cut 75% of the workforce. I don't think a reasonable board would want close a deal where 75% of their workforce gets canceled. In any case, this is very unlikely to closed by 10/31.
Time decay

Increased probability of deal close before the end of October increases the probability of Mr. Agrawal being out of a job. Still very much on a knife's edge as the question close is so close to the expected deal close.

I think Elon musk is poised to cease control of twitter at some point very soon. I said there is a 30% chance that he does it before November 1. I think that although we don't want politics to play a role in the process of timeline, I think that it may play a significant role in having Twitter hold out until after the election.
Musk has to close the deal by October 1 to avoid trial.

Probahilliby Heavy, maintain flight level 21%. On one hand, time has passed without news, but the pivotal moment is to come this month, so we cannot rule out for certain what is to come out of that. It could very much cause a chain of events that causes his resignation, outing, etc. On the flipside, people have argued that this Twitter ordeal may take longer than expected, so be prepared for a longer than expected reign for Agrawal. Holding pattern at 21% for now.

Currently, it seems unlikely that Elon Musk will be able to takeover Twitter prior to 1 November. This destroys any reason Agrawal has to quit or any possibility that he could be fired within the next few weeks. While I doubt that they would ever work as co-CEOs, I find it somewhat likely that Musk's takeover will fail and Agrawal will keep his job. Therefore, Agrawal has an extremely low chance of ceasing his role as CEO prior to the end of the month.

Timing is the primary driver here. If Musk closes the deal by the new 10/28 deadline, the likelihood is higher than 50% he would at least name himself something like interim Co-CEO, and he'd probably do that immediately. However, I think the likelihood of closing by the deadline is still somewhat less than 50%. It makes more sense to me that he would go to trial and try to renegotiate a lower price with Twitter during the trial. What's he got to lose by going to trial? There's no real downside that I can see to going to trial and he could save him self a few billion by renegotiating when Twitter has obviously lost value since the offer was made. Moving up my probability to 10% to reflect the trial date.
While Musk is now willing to revive the deal, there are still questions over financing and whether the purchase may require any kind of regulatory reviews. Doubt it can be done in just two weeks.
The Elon acquisition is one scenario, highly unlikely to end that soon. Another is that he steps down after a year, which could be in part because of all of this.

to express this as an equation -> sigma x over [0, 22], y over [0, 22-x]: P(deal completing in x days) * P(Musk taking taking operational control in (22-x) days) * P(Musk kicking out Agarwal in y days)
In this article, the author reflects and believes that Agrawal will be fired. https://www.npr.org/2022/10/07/1127337447/heres-what-elon-musk-will-likely-do-with-twitter-if-he-buys-it
Musk must complete Twitter deal by Oct. 28 to avoid trial, judge rules

The Drama Queen's funding sources have become sort of skittish, but even if he doesn't get to be Twit King, they should probably dump Agrawal. I find myself increasingly indifferent to this unending sandbox brawl, as there are many issues out there more worthwhile to think about.

Seems like Musk has a tight deadline to meet."We look forward to closing the transaction at $54.20 by Oct. 28th,” Twitter said in a statement. In an earlier court filing, the company urged the judge to reject the proposal, calling Musk's plan "an invitation to further mischief and delay."https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/elon-musk-seeks-stay-twitter-litigation-oct-28-deal-close-2022-10-06/My take is that Twitter is confident that Musk is bluffing. If I had to guess what might happen, I would guess that funding for the deal will not materialise and Musk will then try to shift the blame to the funders that leave him high and dry.
Still seems some way off from concluding. https://www.reuters.com/technology/twitter-opposes-elon-musk-motion-halt-litigation-2022-10-06/
is this a delay tactic by Musk?

I doubt Agrawal will leave of his own volition as, based on what we know about his contract, it seems he's due for a $42 MM windfall provided he gets terminated -- versus quits -- before this time next year.
If Twitter and Musk seal the deal this week or the next. Perhaps Musk plays for time or has another mercurious epiphany. At least, we talk about Elon Musk making probabely a decision.
If the MuskRat really becomes King of the Twits, this guy is probably out; timing is still unsettled, though.

Averaging two estimates. Even though I think it's almost certain (as it applies to this question's criteria) in the next 0.5 years to 1.0 years, I'm still not ruling out a later cessation for undetermined various reasons that yields a NO resolution for this particular question.
Bumping up due to known existence of a contentious relationship between Agrawal and Musk, as pointed out by @orchidny.

With recent new that Musk's Twitter purchase could complete "in a matter of days" (https://www.cnbc.com/2022/10/04/twitter-shares-halted-on-report-that-musk-plans-to-go-through-with-deal-at-54point20-a-share.html) or weeks, it suddenly becomes very tricky to determine how long Agrawal might be in a job. I suspect that if the purchase is not complete before the end of the month, Agrawal will have his job. However, if the purchase does complete within the month, Mr. Agrawal could easily keep his job for a few weeks as he hands over any necessary information and responsibilities to a presumed successor.

It certainly wouldn't be a surprise if it happened at this point. CNBC reported that the deal could close as soon as this Friday. It might not happen if there are closing delays or if Twitter's new ownership wants to keep continuity until a successor is found.

Looks like Elon Musk will not have another option but to buy it. If he does, Agrawal is gone. The thing here is the timing as if they do go in that direction, it may not be finalize in this time frame but an announcement can be made

Even if Musk is now back at the buying Twitter stage (https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-10-04/musk-proposes-to-proceed-with-twitter-deal-at-54-20-a-share), it could be quite a bit more than a month before he gets to fire Parag Agrawal.

While not impossible, the rough path of the takeover bid suggests that in this timeframe Parag Agrawal will remain in his current position past November 1. There is simply not much time or indication to point towards Agrawal being replaced.
The deal is on the rocks and will probably be caught up in the courts for the foreseeable future. I forecast Agrawal will remain for at least another 6 months.
Upping this a tiny bit due to the whistleblower. I don't really think it's relevant, but I think it could be used as a scapegoat.
There's been a huge shift in odds here: https://electionbettingodds.com/MuskCEO2022_week.html
Linear time decay as we approach the question's end date. Not linear decay given recent whistleblower allegations that I think slightly increase the chance of the CEO losing his job.
His role as CEO is tied to 2 things (IMO) - the date of the sale and the progress of the sale.

Updating for passage of time. As of this writing, Mr. Musk is still trying to renege on his takeover bid. Twitter's board appears determined to hold him to it. The only way through is negotiation. Change is sure to come, but deep pockets at play here can pay attorneys to play hot potato for eons. Parag Agrawal's position appears secure - for now.
Whistleblower's testimony before congress.
@probahilliby
Seems like he will stay CEO until the Musk takeover is resolved.
Most likely they will want to have CEO continuity through the ownership battle with Elon Musk. It seems highly unlikely that the takeover dispute will be over by then.
Elon Musk is unpredictable. Before he was trying to get out of the deal, I assumed it would go through and CEO would be in that role for only a short period.

Moving this up a bit on the whistleblower report. Good podcast analysis here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YRU4eNtL4g4 That said, most likely they will want to have CEO continuity through the ownership battle with Elon.

With time passing and November approaching, the probability of Agrawal keeping his job increases. However, there appear to be tumultuous times at Twitter (at least partly due to Musk's actions). It remains unclear to me if the result of this tumult might be the board demanding Agrawal remain in his position as a measure of stability, the board releasing Agrawal as a way to show investors that they are taking action around the problem, or if Agrawal might simply leave and find something better to do than deal with fall out of Musk's mercurial whims.

I think I had been underrating the odds that an *announcement* is made in October if Musk has agreed or been forced to purchase Twitter by then, even though Parag will definitely not leave before November.

Updating for passage of time, reversal of circumstances. Parag's future appears more assured than during the proposed Musk-crat takeover. That deal looks may be mired in the legal system for some time to come. Possibly for the rest of my adult life. That said, there is doubtless some serious wrangling going on in private. Inflation and waning interest in the ravings of a deranged former Tweeter a/k/a TFG/45/PumpkinSpice may have chilling effect on investors at large - and placed Musks's personal interest in controlling the platform permanently on ice. Time will tell. Odds of a job change are pretty high this time of year, Q3, also known as the notorious 'Turkey Drop.' Odds are 1 in 4 that Parag vacates the top job by or before Nov. 1st.
Trial will not be over

With the trial scheduled to start in October, this is highly doubtful. Of course, Elon and Twitter could agree upon a price before then, so if there is news of that happening, these odds should spike.
I'll give it 1% per month

So far, looks like Twitter has the upper hand in their lawsuit against Musk and that case will be in court in October. Unless there is a major settlement before court, which I seriously, I wouldn't think there would be such a major shake up to the company within this time frame.

"Twitter said that it would hold a shareholder meeting to vote on the company’s acquisition by Elon Musk on September 13."https://www.cnbc.com/2022/07/26/twitter-to-hold-vote-on-musk-merger-on-sept-13.html
Trial set for early October, with appeal it is hard to see deal closing by 1 November
Elon exiting deal
Very unlikely he will be done dealing with Elon Musk's temper tantrums by November 1st.

It seems CEO Musk - of another company - is jabbing CEO Agrawal. If I were part of Twitter, if I were Agrawal, most likely it would be quite awkward to step down and leave the "fight" . . . and possibly pass this unresolved issue onto another entity. There remains instability however that does not warrant my complete confidence in NO.

With the Twitter purchase heading for courts it is unlikely to close before November which would be the trigger for replacement of the CEO. Keeping a 15% likelihood since there is a chance that Musk and Twitter board may agree to re-cut the deal at a lower price.
With the Twitter deal on the rocks, I'm revising my forecast down from 86%-9%.

https://www.nytimes.com/2022/07/12/technology/twitter-lawsuit-musk-acquisition.htmlTrial set for September. As other forecasters have pointed out, settlement is far more likely than waiting for a judgment at trial. The problem is that the deal was originally set to terminate no later than October 24, and that very likely will get extended in any renegotiated settlement. It is hard to see Parag going anywhere prior to the deal culminating one way or another. So I'll give 5% for the deal just falling through and Musk walking away entirely followed by Parag's early exit, and 12% for the deal somehow closing before November. I know Musk is a "loose cannon" but on reflection I don't think he has actually done a full 180 turn, I think he just doesn't want to pay almost double current market price for the stock. Also, the entire board signed on for this deal, not just Parag, so there is no real reason for him specifically to be the fall guy if it doesn't work out.
Well, this has got interesting.

@orchidny made a hypothesis: "Assuming the board will want to keep Agrawal on for the time being as the legal battle takes shape but if stock price drops significantly, they may need to quickly reshuffle leadership." [1]
A bit more optimistic than the crowd. See below:
Very helpful chart, which includes a highly intriguing potential outcome: https://www.axios.com/2022/07/08/elon-musk-twitter-deal-delaware-court-lawsuit

With Musk attempting to either cancel the takeover deal or get a lower price this appears to be heading to court. I don’t know how long these type of cases generally take, but I’m using this impending litigation in the courts to decrease the likelihood of Agrawal of leaving his position during this time frame. I haven’t researched the number of CEOs who leave the company after a failed takeover. If I can find that information, I will adjust accordingly.
NY Times updated their article to indicate he may just be trying to renegotiate the price. Twitter chair says they will go to court to enforce the takeover.

With the recent news that Musk does not want to purchase Twitter, the probability of Agrawal keeping his job goes up substantially. However, the possibility remains that Agrawal either leaves his position by his own volition or that the volatility ends with the Twitter board removing him (of course, one could also argue that volatility is a reason to keep Agrawal as changing CEOs might only make things worse).

Now that Elon Musk says his advisers sent a letter to Twitter formally notifying the company that he is terminating the merger agreement, and that Twitter vows to take legal action against Musk to enforce their $44 billion deal, do the odds of Agrawal staying in increase or decrease? Assuming the board will want to keep Agrawal on for the time being as the legal battle takes shape but if stock price drops significantly, they may need to quickly reshuffle leadership.

https://www.nytimes.com/2022/07/08/technology/elon-musk-twitter.htmlTwo possibilities, either Musk is bluffing in order to renegotiate a better price, or Parag ends up getting the boot anyway because Twitter will need a fresh start after this whole mess is over. In either case, the original timeline of closing the deal by October is clearly dead.
Twitter layoffs have begun
The board has unanimously recommended the takeover, no new evidence that Musk is backing out

Since i have a contrarian view here - listing down the reasons.1> The acquisition has to be completed before 1st November. This looks unlikely now with Musk coming to his senses (that he is overpaying for twitter) and trying to establish Material adverse change by insisting twitter was not forthcoming about the number of users on its platform. (the general opinion is that this is farfetched and will be hard to establish) . But this probably ensures that the merger timeline will be stretched. The consequences of backing out of the merger are high too (potential lawsuits + 1$ bn payout).

Base cases are hard when trying to predict what Elon Musk does! But let's break it down. There are really three ways that Parag can no longer be CEO: he resigns, he is fired (or asked to leave) by the board/owner, or he becomes co-CEO.
Elon's purchase of Twitter is halting, or at least slowing down a lot.

For a while it seemed that Elon Musk was having serious regrets about going through with the deal and was actively looking into getting out of it. Twitter said it'd enforced its side of the deal and now Musk is once again making moves this week to get funding. Musk is giving all indications that he is trying to buy for a lower price and if he's successful, Agrawal is out the door.
Inspired by @alh's reasoning here https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1457520 while still respecting my previous calculation here https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1456204.
Increasing on increased likelihood he will be removed given Musk pressure.
I'm a bit less confident now. It seems Elon may be trying to get out of the deal or get a cheaper price. To its credit, Twitter management is refusing to budge on the $54.20.

Assuming most places put the odds at 2 to 1 in favor of Elon becoming a Twitter CEO by the start of next year, and that this question covers about 70% of this relevant time period, and I put maybe a 10% increase in weight to the time period before November 1, then I get just about 53%, plus or minus.

With Musk waffling over the purchase (at least publicly) and lack of clarity over whether Twitter would attempt to force the sale and how long that might take, I am reducing the probability of Parag being out of a job.
I doubt Musk will buy twitter.
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-05-17/elon-musk-says-twitter-must-prove-bot-claims-for-deal-to-proceed?srnd=premium
"Reuters explains that this has caused discontent among Twitter lawyers since Musk’s statements regarding the calculation methodology violated a confidentiality contract between the company and him."
Musk deal needs to go through and he needs to make the position change.

Historical data suggests this deal closes at a high rate. Whether it closes or breaks should easily fall within this timeline. Stock market suggests odds are on the low end of the spectrum but there are not a lot of good reasons for it. DMA signed. DMA is tight. Twitter is a good buy at the price agreed. Much better than Tesla stock to own. Probability seems low Musk leaves Agrawal in the sole CEO role. Even if the deal somehow fails there is a chance Agrawal needs to leave or gets kicked out over that. He could also leave for unrelated reasons although the probability of that is probably low. Co-CEO could be appointed for some reason but the probability of that seems remote atm.

Musk recently put the deal "on hold," and while it's not clear to me that this will definitely slow down or end the deal, it is definitely not an accelerant to Agrawal leaving the job: https://www.livemint.com/news/world/elon-musk-says-twitter-deal-temporarily-on-hold-11652435365661.html
Musk says "still committed to acquisition"(I think he is maybe trying to renegotiate at a lower price)
Musk says deal 'temporarily on hold'
https://www.msn.com/en-us/autos/news/two-top-twitter-executives-step-down-in-management-shakeup/ar-AAXcw9lleadership shakeups already beginning

The market is pricing Twitter stock as only 50% likely that the deal goes through at its current price. Totally possible that the deal gets renegotiated at a lower price and still goes through, but this may delay the closing date.
not certain that Musk's offer genuine or will be successful.

https://www.msn.com/en-us/money/companies/ftc-to-review-musk-e2-80-99s-2444b-twitter-buy-under-anti-trust-report/ar-AAWXQvKFTC probing the deal for antitrust reasons. I have no doubt that Musk would win any antitrust battle should one occur, but even a spurious lawsuit from the FTC would likely delay a merger unless a judge threw it out quickly
Another possibility: if the deal falls through, Parag might be out anyway just because his leadership will have been defined by this whole episode, and Twitter will be due for an overhaul regardless
Today there are news that Musk is likely to become temporary CEO of Twitter after a takeover. 90% is the estimate of a likelihood of a deal closing.

Recent news indicates that Musk is successfully putting together a coalition of investors to secure missing financing for the deal, meanwhile he has already signed a document accepting a $1 billion penalty should he back out for failing to secure investment (among other possibilities). One source is already reporting that Musk is set to take over as Twitter's CEO once the deal completes, though a specific timeline for this is not clear: https://www.nationalreview.com/news/elon-musk-to-serve-as-twitter-ceo-after-takeover/

I'm convinced now that 1) Elon is 100% serious about it and 2) He will replace Parag ASAP (multiple sources reporting this). Also Parag said on the leaked internal meeting that Oct 27 is the latest the deal can close unless they run into regulatory problems. Since all that has to happen is an announcement, this could even resolve a lot earlier if Twitter announces the CEO will leave before the deal is 100% closed.

Following a takeover, regime change is the norm. Historically, Elon Musk has not failed to raise funds for his endeavors. Musk does have a history of changing is mind. Either way, I suspect that Agrawal is already planning his next career move.
This is exceptionally likely, given the Twitter purchase goes through. I also think it's exceptionally likely that the twitter purchase happens.

Updating forecast with key information that I missed earlier - if Elon fails to raise the capital (or several other circumstances which I had considered) and the deal falls through for those reasons, he will be required to pay Twitter $1 billion: https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/1418091/000119312522120461/d310843d8k.htm
https://finance.yahoo.com/news/elon-musk-twitter-tweet-embeds-charge-173354164.html"Twitter's potential new owner is also said to have plans to replace CEO Parag Agrawal"
Today's rumour is that the MuskRat already has a name in mind. Be still, my heart.

https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-shadow-crew-who-encouraged-elon-musks-twitter-takeover-tesla-jack-dorsey-11651260119Elon started acquiring Twitter stock in January and has a cadre of friends who are supporting his offer. To my mind this puts to shame the notion that this was a lark and he will get bored next month and abandon the deal. He could swallow the $1bn financial penalty for backing out of the deal, but not the reputational damage
If the deal to sell to Elon Musk and take the company private goes through, Parag is out in 6 months, likely less if he quits before that.
https://www.reuters.com/breakingviews/elon-musk-probably-wont-buy-twitter-2022-04-27/

I’m not well versed in M &A and payout packages for executives but if Parag Agrawal is terminated within the next 12 months he’s due for a hefty 38-43M payout package. Not sure if that’s something the new owners will want to pay on top. Using that along with the short time frame to close this as a result in Parag staying a bit longer. Starting with a low estimate for now.

Updating previous forecast - Musk is financing part of the deal using a margin loan on shares of his Tesla stock. With the recent precipitous drop in Tesla stock and his current choice to not reveal where he plans to receive the rest of his funding, it's unclear if the deal can go through.

Parag said in the leaked all hands meeting that this can take "3 to 6 months, or longer" for the deal to close. If it's on the high end, there just won't be enough time for this to happen. If it's on the low end, there will be more than enough time. Taking a median estimate of 4.5 months, that would put us in mid September with 1.5 months left before the deadline. I think that is enough time for Musk to at least announce Parag's end date if he's going for a fast and early purge (which I still think is likely).
Updating earlier forecast -
@probahilliby

Lowering as I am seeing reports of "could take until end of year" to close the deal, and then for all we know Parag stays on for some (brief?) period of time after that. In any case I'm incredibly uncertain about timetable here, and it seems like the market is too given that Twitter is trading like 10% under the deal price.

Based on recent news of Musk's purchase of Twitter, the story @DNK89 linked to about Musk's history of firing those who disagree with him, and that Musk wants to take Twitter in a different direction, I am updating my forecast to a 70% chance Agrawal will no longer be the company's sole CEO by November.
I think this question breaks down into a few pieces:

If the deal goes through, this guy's gone on a fairly pronto basis. There is little tolerance for rational behaviour in the Musk Multiverse. If the takeover goes as Musk presumably wants, there will be a tremendous surge of crazies onto Twitter, followed by a gradual erosion as the grownups go elsewhere.
90% likelihood of transaction closing and 90% likelihood of Musk looking to replace CEO after takeover

He has made his views about Twitter`s management clear and there is this - https://www.businessinsider.in/thelife/news/elon-musk-ruthlessly-cleaned-house-of-any-tesla-workers-who-disagreed-or-got-in-his-way-a-new-book-says/articleshow/85016138.cms
Deal fails to close (5%)
Elon has said he has no confidence in present management, so it's hard to see a scenario in which he stays.
with the news of the Musk buy-out occurring - i think its only a matter of time

It is increasingly difficult to care about following the nonstop soap opera that is the MuskRat. It goes on forever; call it, then, Elongate. Going with 60% right now, because that's all the interest I can muster. Sooner or later I'll have to resort to thinking, I suppose.

With the Musk deal this seems like a certainty eventually. I would expect Elon to want to make a quick early publicly visible action to signal a change in the direction of company and changes to the CEO seems like the most obvious route for that. Only question is the timeline, and with the board already choosing to not fight the takeover too aggressively I would expect Elon to be able to make his desired changes to management before November; even if it is some sort of co-CEO situation for a transitionary period.

Musk deal is officially real. Only question is timetable which I'm not totally sure on. Plus he could still back out until something is signed.edit: guy on Bloomberg TV mentions that the SEC has to approve the deal, and the SEC doesn't like Musk. Although I doubt that they have any real grounds to block it
Looks like TWTR board has accepted Elon Musk's offer.
Seems the ownership of the company will change and with that a new CEO....

With Twitter's Board set to accept Elon Musk's offer to purchase the company, Musk's criticism of Twitter under Agrawal's leadership, and Musk's pledge to not pay Board members if he owns the company, I find it highly-likely that Agrawal will be removed or resign before November 2022.
just announced that the deal is going through

There is an important time-table issue here in the sense that I have no clue how long it will actually take for Musk to formally complete any acquisition. That said it seems like if he takes over (likely - 75%?) he will almost certainly do this.
recent reporting seems to indicate Musk's offer to buy is gaining steam with investor backing
For this to happen, one of the following needs to occur:

This prediction is subject to change with new information coming almost daily, lately. We may know very soon whether Musk goes forward, beyond filing papers and arranging financing, in his hostile takeover bid

Elon Musk has been buying a significant share of Twitter stock. He has a history of being an activist investor. The board's attempt to bring Elon Musk onto the board fell apart in days. Elon Musk wants to change Twitter and I think he has the ability to do so.
I interpret this is a proxy question for "will Elon Musk buy Twitter OR provoke a shareholder revolt by 1 Nov?" and give it less than 1/4 odds out the gate, based on the board's poison pill strategy.
